DOC.brief_summary: The aim project compare nephro-protective effect high-dose atorvastatin high-dose rosuvastatin incidence Contrast Induced-Acute Kidney Injury patient non-ST-elevation acute coronary syndrome schedule early invasive strategy .
DOC.brief_title: Atorvastatin Versus Rosuvastatin Contrast Induced Acute Kidney Injury ( PRATO-ACS 2 )
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , single-centre , randomized study , design compare nephro-protective effect high-dose atorvastatin high-dose rosuvastatin incidence Contrast Induced-Acute Kidney Injury ( CI-AKI ) . Consecutive statin-naïve patient admit investigator institution non-ST elevation Acute Coronary Syndrome ( NSTE-ACS ) schedule early invasive strategy eligible . Patients randomize two group : 1 ) high-dose rosuvastatin ( 40 mg on-admission follow 20 mg/day ) ; 2 ) high-dose atorvastatin ( 80 mg on-admission follow 40 mg/day ) . Randomization perform on-admission computerized open-label assignment blind envelope use consecutive fashion . All patient receive standard pre-procedural hydration . The primary end-point proportion patient increase serum creatinine ≥ 0.5 mg/dl ≥ 25 % baseline within 72 hour contrast medium administration . The secondary end-points persistent worsen renal damage ( eGFR reduction > = 25 % 30 day ) cumulative adverse clinical event follow-up . Specifically : death , myocardial infarction , dialysis , stroke persistent renal damage 30 day ; death myocardial infarction 6 12 month .
DOC.criteria: All consecutive statinnaive patient non STelevation acute coronary syndrome admit institution schedule early invasive strategy consider enrollment Current statin treatment Highrisk feature warrant emergency coronary angiography ( within 2 hour ) Acute renal failure endstage renal failure require dialysis serum creatinine ≥ 3 mg/dl Severe comorbidities preclude early invasive strategy Contraindications statin treatment Contrast medium administration within last 10 day Pregnancy Refusal consent
